Vretta offers the perfect environment to learn and thrive at an industry-leading ed-tech company! We love STEM and our passion is to make STEM and literacy assessment more efficient and innovative. We offer fully remote work or full freedom of choosing to work hybrid if you are located in Toronto. We would love our co-op students to have excellent communication skills, creative problem solving ability, and a sound technical ability to be able to understand requirements, develop technological solutions, and maintain systems that support student learning and assessment. A Software Developer Co-op at Vretta should have a can-do attitude and innovative spirit to generate creative solutions and support brand success. Responsibilities • Validate technical requirements and communicate implementation strategies • Develop features in collaboration with Instructional Designers, Data Engineers, and other members of the development and technical team to deliver projects. • Use existing code components to implement into new projects • Maintain and modify existing applications. • Debug, test, and deploy software implementations. • Interact with key partners and internal users regarding timelines, technical issues, and infrastructure integration. • Provide recommendations for improvements in the overall development process. • Ensure work progress to schedule and keep (internal) customers informed of project progress. Stay current with relevant research, techniques, technology and other factors impacting the job. • Benefits • Remote Work: Students can work from their own office (home, coffee shop, etc.) and also have the option to work from our Innovation Hub located at 300-120 Adelaide Street East, Toronto, ON M5C 1K9. • Paid Holidays: Students get ten paid statutory holidays throughout the year. • Training and Mentorship: Students get to receive training and mentorship from subject matter experts and gain first-hand experience with development, engineering along the product and project teams. • Nurturing Learning Environment: Students get to work with an international team in an industry-leading ed-tech company, familiarize themselves with education and technology trends and acquire a growth mindset. About Vretta Vretta is a multi-award winning organization that specializes in delivering assessment and learning experiences that support student-success at the primary, secondary, and post-secondary educational levels. With over a decade of research and dedication in understanding how students succeed by interacting with rich and engaging technology-enhanced assessments, Vretta specializes in the innovative use of assessments to provide greater equity and strengthen the skills of students. We focus on modernizing assessment and learning solutions through creative design, backed by psychometric precision, delivering reliable, flexible and equitable learning and assessment experiences for students, educators, and administrators. Applying Vretta is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs in all stages of the hiring process. We also engage in proactive employment practices adhering to the Employment Equity Act of Canada (Loi sur l'équité en matière d'emploi) to increase the representation of four designated groups: women, people with disabilities, Aboriginal peoples, and visible minorities.
